content:
Excellent plan! You're already identifying pockets of time in your daily routine where you can fit in some writing. That's a great step towards making writing a habit.

Using your morning commute to write is a fantastic idea. You can take advantage of that extra 15-20 minutes to get your creative juices flowing. Freewriting or working on a short story during this time can help you:

* Warm up your writing muscles
* Get your thoughts and ideas down on paper
* Make progress on your writing projects

And what a great idea to write before your yoga class! Writing can be a wonderful way to clear your mind and get focused before a physical activity like yoga. It can help you:

* Center yourself and quiet your mind
* Release any tension or stress
* Get into a flow state, which can enhance your yoga practice

Remember, the goal is to make writing a habit, and it's essential to start small and be consistent. By committing to these short writing sessions, you'll be surprised at how quickly you can make progress on your writing projects.

To help you stay on track, I recommend setting reminders on your phone or putting a note in your calendar to remind you to write during these times. You can also try to create a pre-writing routine to signal to your brain that it's time to write. This could be as simple as making a cup of coffee, putting on a specific playlist, or doing a quick stretch.

How do you feel about sharing your writing goals and progress with Jamie, your graphic designer friend from yoga class? Sometimes having a writing buddy or accountability partner can help motivate you to stay on track.
